item.description:
Blue Hills Reservation is certainly the best destination for hikers looking for a great experience without the hassle of driving for 3 hours to New Hampshire or Eastern Massachusetts.

On this 6-mile loop in Blue Hills Reservation, you’ll see dense hardwoods, meadows, ponds, glacial leftovers, rocky hills, and sweeping views of Boston.

Direction to traihead: I-93 S to exit 5B (MA 28 N/Milton). Take MA 28 N for .5 mi. and park in small dirt clearing on L.

Trail Description:

We will hop on blue-blazed Skyline Trail to Blue Hills Reservation Location: 42.21457°, -71.06989°

Swing R @ 2054 marker onto gravel road, then cross Hillside St. Location: 42.21235°, -71.09251°

Look for blue-blazed North Skyline Trail to L of park HQ building Location: 42.21435°, -71.09410°

At five Corners; bear R, staying on Skyline toward Great Blue Hill Location: 42.21700°, -71.10267°

Quick side trip: Bear R @ Y for beautiful picnic spots near two ponds; return to main trail and turn R for Woolcott Hill. Then it’s a steep, rocky ascent of Great Blue Hill Location: 42.21615°, -71.10551°

Summit: Stone tower with views of skyline and harbor. Continue W on Skyline Trail .1 mi. to weather observatory (founded 1885) then retrace E on Skyline Trail for .05 mi. and turn R onto S. Skyline Trail Location: 42.21358°, -71.11266°

R onto blue-blazed S. Skyline Trail for rocky descent, then uphill through pines and past glacial remains Location: 42.21258°, -71.11265°

Cross Hillside St.; L then quick R through parking lot, following Skyline Trail; in .1 mi., when Skyline Trail goes L, continue straight on gravel road then bear L on paved Bugbee Path, heading uphill Location: 42.21282°, -71.09682°

L onto orange-blazed Massachuseuck Trail (where road widens); at next T-junction, go L onto Doe Hollow Path Location: 42.21102°, -71.08990°

Bear R, leaving Doe Hollow Path; continue on orange-blazed trail; gradual climb on loose rock and packed-dirt trail Location: 42.21308°, -71.07898°

R to rejoin Skyline Trail (blue and orange trails overlap) to trailhead Location: 42.21468°, -71.07159°

All maybes will be changed to No's on December 9 so that anyone interested in going may attend.
item.how_to_find_us: DIANNE AND I WILL BE IN A BLACK TOYOTA ECHO WITH MAINE PLATES
item.name: SKYLINE TRAIL LOOP
